description: Cross-cutting documentation guidelines for all languages in this repo.

# Documentation Instructions

<!-- Source: Adapted from github/awesome-copilot -->

## General Documentation Principles

- Keep documentation up to date
- Write for your audience
- Use clear and concise language
- Include examples and use cases
- Document the "why" not just the "what"
- Use consistent formatting
- Make documentation discoverable
- Review documentation in code reviews

## Code Documentation

- Document public APIs
- Use consistent doc comment style
- Include parameter descriptions
- Document return values
- Document exceptions/errors
- Provide usage examples
- Explain complex logic
- Update comments when code changes
- Avoid obvious comments

## README Files

- Include project overview
- List prerequisites and requirements
- Provide installation instructions
- Include quick start guide
- Document configuration options
- List available commands
- Include contribution guidelines
- Add license information
- Provide contact information

## API Documentation

- Document all endpoints
- Describe request/response formats
- Include authentication requirements
- Provide example requests and responses
- Document error codes
- Explain rate limits
- Include versioning information
- Use OpenAPI/Swagger when possible
- Keep documentation in sync with code

## Architecture Documentation

- Document system architecture
- Create architecture diagrams
- Explain design decisions
- Document dependencies
- Describe data flow
- Include deployment architecture
- Document security considerations
- Explain scalability approach

## User Documentation

- Write for end users
- Use screenshots and visuals
- Provide step-by-step guides
- Include troubleshooting section
- Use clear headings and structure
- Make searchable
- Include FAQ section
- Provide video tutorials when helpful

## Developer Documentation

- Document development setup
- Include coding standards
- Explain project structure
- Document build and deployment
- Provide debugging tips
- Explain testing approach
- Include common workflows
- Document tools and dependencies

## Changelog

- Document all notable changes
- Use semantic versioning
- Group changes by type (Added, Changed, Deprecated, Removed, Fixed, Security)
- Include release dates
- Link to relevant issues/PRs
- Keep in reverse chronological order
- Follow Keep a Changelog format

## Inline Comments

- Explain complex algorithms
- Clarify non-obvious code
- Document workarounds
- Explain business logic
- Use TODO/FIXME/NOTE markers
- Keep comments concise
- Avoid redundant comments
- Update comments with code

## Documentation Tools

- Use markdown for text documentation
- Use diagrams for architecture (Mermaid, PlantUML)
- Use JSDoc/TypeDoc for TypeScript
- Use Sphinx/MkDocs for Python
- Use rustdoc for Rust
- Use static site generators
- Version documentation with code
- Make documentation searchable
